metadata.title: CVE-2017-17915 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In GraphicsMagick 1.4 snapshot-20171217 Q8, there is a heap-based bufferover-read in ReadMNGImage in coders/png.c, related to accessing one bytebefore testing whether a limit has been reached.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17915` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm6
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm6
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm6
libgraphicsmagick++3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm6
libgraphicsmagick3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm6').
